meanings.definition: The act of subjecting seeds or plants to a period of cold in order to induce flowering.
meanings.sent1: The vernalizations of the seeds in the fridge helped them bloom beautifully in spring.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use vernalizations to make sure their crops grow well during the right season.
meanings.sent3: The seeds were so excited for their chilly vernalizations, they threw a frosty party!
meanings.sent4: The vernalizations acted like a magical spell, awakening the dormant plants with a touch of frost.
meanings.sent5: The vernalizations were like a gentle winter lullaby, coaxing the flowers to wake up in time for the sun.

meanings.definition: The process of exposing plants to cold temperatures to stimulate growth or flowering.
meanings.sent1: During the vernalizations, the plants shivered in the cold but knew it was for their own good.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners carefully monitor the vernalizations to ensure their plants thrive in the changing weather.
meanings.sent3: The plants whispered to each other during the vernalizations, wondering when they would get to wear their flowery dresses.
meanings.sent4: The vernalizations were like a refreshing spa day for the plants, invigorating them for the upcoming season.
meanings.sent5: The vernalizations were like a winter dance party, with the plants swaying to the rhythm of the frosty air.
